intro: Dryopsis obtusiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
